"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a2346e6368720a77090700#post_54a2346e6368720a77090700
[bq="Carcass Strife"]If I ever met Obama, the first question I woukd ask him is: How does it feel to be the last black president?

-#Shotsfired-[/bq]
I know this is a joke, but I have to correct something; approval rating wise if you compare his approval rating vs past presidents in their coming up sixth year as president his approval rating is actually fairly high.  It's probably why republicans are trying super hard to destroy his approval rating because once a president leaves office their approval rating shoots up.

Basically in 2025 the top three presidents by popularity are going to be 1)Abraham 2)JFK 3)Obama

I'm meh about him, but I do have to give him credit where it's due: he is extremely damn good at keeping his approval rating up over time.

I haven't learnt much about presidents, so you're not being clear.
*Duct tape your mouth*
Now shush.[/bq]
Short version is that chances are that the USA will never have a caucasian male president again.  The next president is going to be Hillary; the next president is probably going to be a minority because Hillary and Obama's potentially approval ratings upon leaving office will be high enough that both parties will have candidates that are women or minorities as a means of getting the vote; by the time the president after Hillary leaves office caucasians will be the minority in the USA.

Tl:dr cause I know I'm annoying you; the USA will never have another caucasian straight male president.

Good point; okay: the probability of caucasian straight male presidents from now on are marginally low and that as time goes on less and less of them will become presidents; as in it'll be several decades until we have another straight male president and after that president it'll be several decades until the next one and as time goes on they'll become rare and rarer due to caucasians becoming the minority.

Basically the next straight male president will probably be in the 2030's; the one after that will probably be in the 2050's and so forth.
